Key Match Events: DL Hall worked seven scoreless innings in the best start of his career.
Willy Adames and Rhys Hoskins each homered and drove in three runs.
The Milwaukee Brewers scored 10 runs in the ninth inning to pound the Cincinnati Reds 14-0.
The Brewers won the opener 5-4 in ten innings.
Garrett Mitchell homered for Milwaukee in the sixth inning.
Hoskins hit a two-run shot in the seventh inning.
William Contreras hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning.
Rhett Lowder made his major league debut for the Reds.
Post-Match Reflections: DL Hall expressed satisfaction with his performance, stating he finally felt like himself again.
Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised DL Hall's performance.
Rhett Lowder described his debut as a dream come true.
Reds manager David Bell commented on Lowder's poise during his debut.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers stole four bases, two by Brice Turang.
The Reds fell to 3-4 in extra innings, while the Brewers improved to 6-5.
Brewers: LHP Wade Miley began throwing and is seeing Dr. Timothy Kremchek in Cincinnati to assess his progress.
Reds: RHP Hunter Greene has reduced pain from the contusion on his right elbow and began throwing.
